message: Hi Bob, I'm excited to discuss the product with you! I think it's a great opportunity for us to work together. I'm willing to offer you the product for $110. What do you think?
I appreciate your initial offer, but I was thinking more along the lines of $80. Would you be willing to sell it to me for that price?

Thanks for your offer, Bob! I understand you're looking to get a good deal, but I'm not willing to sell it to you for $80. I'm willing to meet you in the middle and offer it to you for $100. What do you think?
I appreciate your willingness to meet me in the middle, but I'm still a bit higher than that. How about we try $90?
I understand you're still looking for a better deal, Bob. I'm willing to compromise and offer it to you for $105. This is as low as I'm willing to go. What do you think?
I appreciate your willingness to compromise, but I'm still a bit higher than that. How about we try $95?
I'm starting to get a bit frustrated, Bob. I've already compromised a lot, and I'm not willing to go any lower. I'm willing to offer it to you for $108. This is my final offer. What do you think?
I understand you're getting frustrated, but I'm still willing to negotiate. I'm thinking $85 is a fair price for the product. Can you meet me there?
Bob, I'm not willing to go as low as $85. I think I've already compromised enough. I'm willing to offer it to you for $98. This is my final offer. What do you think?
I'm willing to walk away if I don't get a good deal. I'm thinking $90 is the absolute maximum I'm willing to pay. If you can meet me there, I'll buy the product from you.
